content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #158

## May 2019 Ballot Comment: Provide cast-hub and hub.topic concepts definition before using them

Submitted by Ricardo Quintano Neira on behalf of @bvdh
Chapter/section: SMART Launch Example
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: A-S Clarification

Summary: Provide cast-hub and hub.topic concepts definition before using them

Comment: Provide cast-hub and hub.topic concepts definition before using them

Existing wording: Note that the SMART launch parameters include the Hub's base url and and the session identifier in the cast-hub and hub.topic fields

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

wmaethner commented on Issue #158:

Related to the abstract, or should we just put in an explanatory sentence before using these terms?

isaacvetter commented on Issue #158:

Proposed resolution: Persuasive
Proposed resolution: Will define these terms in the specification before, or as part of first use.

wmaethner labeled Issue #158:

wmaethner commented on Issue #158:

## :landline: II Working Group Vote (6-18-2019)
Block vote

@isaacvetter moved the following disposition, seconded by Ricardo Quintano Neira

Disposition: Persuasive with mod
Disposition Comment: Will fix as described in the issue comments or by the commenter

:+1: For: 10
:expressionless: Abstain: 2
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:

isaacvetter commented on Issue #158:

terms are now more clearly defined in the session discovery section:

A session is an abstract concept representing a shared workspace, such as user's login session over multiple applications or a shared view of one application distributed to multiple users. FHIRcast requires a session to have a unique, unguessable and opaque identifier. This identifier is exchanged as the value of the hub.topic parameter. Before establishing a subscription, an app must not only know the hub.topic, but also the the hub.url which contains the base url of the Hub.

isaacvetter closed Issue #158:
